intro: Comolia bracteosa, commonly known as the bracted comolia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Comolia bracteosa is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
